top_categories.workout_context: Bighorn Gravel's Mountain gravel, High altitude forces constant power changes. Surge over the rough stuff, settle on the smooth, repeat for 62 miles.
Race-pace efforts that mimic Bighorn Gravel's demands. Pacing, fueling, and tactical decisions under fatigue. Practice the race before June.
6,000ft of climbing means repeated surges above threshold. VO2max work is how you survive the fifth climb, not just the first.
97ft/mi means long efforts at or near FTP on every climb. If your threshold cracks at minute 15, you'll walk the rest.
At Bighorn Gravel, surges push you above threshold and you have to recover while still riding. Over-unders train exactly that.
88–92% FTP is where you'll spend the hardest sustained miles of Bighorn Gravel. Train it until it feels boring.
6,000ft of climbing on grades that change every minute. You need to switch from seated to standing without losing rhythm.
62 miles on Colorado mountain gravel burns energy faster than the distance suggests. Train the fade resistance now.
How long can you hold 105% FTP before you blow? At Bighorn Gravel, that number decides whether you bridge or get dropped.
Base fitness for Bighorn Gravel. Without this, the hard workouts break you down instead of building you up.
Low-cadence force work for 6,000ft of climbing. The slow, grinding ascents where you can't spin—you push.
Short, max efforts are unavoidable. Punchy climbs, gap closures, attacks on Colorado mountain gravel. If you haven't trained them, you'll crack.

race_overlay.nutrition: Target 40–60g carbs/hour for Bighorn Gravel’s 62 miles. Front-load calories in the first half. One bottle per hour minimum, more in heat.
race_overlay.altitude: Bighorn Gravel with 6,000ft of climbing, much of it above 8,000ft demands altitude preparation. Arrive 5–7 days early for acclimatization. Expect 5–15% power reduction at altitude. Increase iron intake 4 weeks out. Hydrate aggressively — altitude increases fluid loss by 20–40%. High altitude (7000-9000+ feet); Sun exposure at altitude.
race_overlay.terrain: Mixed terrain at Bighorn Gravel requires surface adaptability. Include weekly rides on colorado mountain gravel to build confidence. Expect: mountain gravel, high altitude, significant climbing.

pack_summary: This 10-workout pack focuses on Gravel Specific, Race Simulation, and VO2max to prepare you for 62 miles of colorado mountain gravel in Gypsum, Colorado.
